title: What the budget means for FDs
text:
Posted: 15   
From getting tougher with tax dodgers to potentially bringing pensions and ISAs together under the same tax regime arrangements, yesterday's budget offered plenty for FDs to digest. 
As with the pre-election Budget in March, yesterday's so-called 'Emergency Budget' or 'Summer Budget' was as much about politics as anything else, and the Chancellor George Osborne was in buoyant mood as he talked up the strength of the UK economy. 
Of course, finance directors need to have a sound assessment of the country's economic outlook in order to help set their own financial plans. But there was also plenty of meat to chew over from Osborne's announcement, particularly around clampdowns on tax avoidance and a move to raise the bank levy. 
Director of Finance looks at the summer budget's key points and commentary with regards to the economy, tax and pensions.
